Reason: The 'keyspace_count_warn_threshold' configuration is considered performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the performance of schema-dependent cluster operations. Having a large number of keyspaces can significantly slow down these operations, and setting an appropriate threshold for the keyspace count can help in maintaining optimal performance. This can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
